conclusion: Analyze the difference in speed between objects A and B during the time interval from 0 to t1.
The vertical axis represents velocity (v), and the horizontal axis represents time (t). Curve A represents object A, and curve B represents object B.
The speed difference between objects A and B at any time is the absolute difference between their velocities, |v_A - v_B|.
At t = 0, both objects start at the same velocity (v_A = v_B), so the speed difference is zero.
As time increases from 0 to t1, the velocity of object A increases, while the velocity of object B is constant, so the speed difference |v_A - v_B| increases.
At t = t1, the velocity of object A has reached its maximum value, and the velocity of object B remains constant. The speed difference is at its maximum.
The speed difference increases continuously from 0 to t1, meaning it is continuously increasing during this time interval.
Yes, the difference in speed between the two objects is continuously increasing from 0 to t1.
